hypothesis_content.title: Post-News Sentiment Exhaustion Fade
hypothesis_content.statement: When major crypto news triggers >3% BTC move within 30 minutes during NEUTRAL/BEAR regimes, and social sentiment (weighted CryptoFear&Greed + social volume) reaches extreme (>75 or <25), fading the initial move yields positive expectancy over next 6-12 hours as sentiment normalizes.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral/bear regimes lack sustained momentum to follow through on news spikes. Retail overreaction dominates initial moves, while institutional players wait for liquidity before taking contrary positions. Sentiment extremes in these regimes have historically reverted faster than in bull markets.
entry_conditions: BTC 30m absolute return >3% following identifiable news catalyst
CryptoFear&Greed Index >75 (for short fade) or <25 (for long fade)
Aggregated social volume (CryptoPanic/alternative.me) spikes >2 standard deviations above 24h average
Entry on 1h candle close after conditions met, in direction opposite initial spike

exit_conditions.take_profit: 50% retracement of the initial 30m news-driven move
exit_conditions.stop_loss: News-driven move extends by additional 1.5x its initial magnitude

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Fewer than 55% of trades reach 50% retracement before stop loss, or average win/loss ratio <1.3 across 50+ instances.
